ygData.messageBody:
On Wed, 21 Apr 1999, Rebecca Taylor wrote:

> I personally find it interesting. Free enterprise at work. It is lame if it
> gets to the point that they are stealing kills from monks and then trying
> to sell them back to the monks. That's taking advantage.

This apparently has happened to a former monk friend of mine. Very
annoying.

> Why does this bother you? You are asking a favor of somebody. You don't
> have to pay. Clerics aren't there for your convience. How about charging
> for binding? Or having somebody help find your corpse? Is this lame as
> well? I can understand that it would be lame if the cleric is in your own
> party and charges you. I would dump that party member awful quick.

You make some excellent points here Rebecca, and I think I'm going to have
to relent on it. It really is little more than a personal ethic and belief
more so than any actually defensible position. I myself believe that you
will come out better in the long run in helping people, but for those that
wish to attempt to make a profit off of it, I really don't have a leg to
stand on in saying this is 'WRONG'.

I do think that people whom take advantage of a persons generosity are
wrong and are being rude, but once again, this is little more than pushing
my own opinions and world views upon them. Which is never a wise idea.


Dirque
He who's corpses litter the landscape like dandelions in spring
